Apr 14

Bot Developers: What Will We See At F8?

Are you excited for F8 2017? I am!

F8 2106 brought us the opportunity to develop for Messenger, which gave birth to more than 30K bots on its platform (I’m representing two, Vietnamese Sumi and Catbot). This year, I hope to see a more mature ecosystem and more integration with the other FB properties (Page, Analytics, etc.).

Pre-F8, a few announcements have already made headlines:

  1. Bot to Group Communication
  2. Mention Alert and Emoji Reaction to Messages [Already Released]
  3. Default Persistent Menu [Already Released]

But the F8 agenda page does not have a filter for Bots — so here is my personal guide to the event:

Must-See: Bots Talks

(filter for Messenger from the agenda page)

This is a no-brainer, as these are all important topics. I expect to hear new announcements at the Tuesday 1:00 pm session. The presenters, Mikhail and Helen, are familiar names for the Bot community.

Highly Relevant: Ad & Monetization

How do people discover Bots on FB? That is a permanent question for developers. For now, many rely on FB ads. If that is you, Ad & Monetization will be relevant. Except for the Canvas talk on Tues at 4pm, all others are about discovery and user journey.

Might Be Interesting: Analytics

FB Analytics is free and also supports Bots (which it counts as an App). This is incredible useful if Bots is not your ONLY channel, but part of a bigger business strategy (web, app, etc.) Not relevant if you have in-house or 3rd party analytics.

Might Be Interesting: Growth

These sessions are designed for a more generic audience, covering a variety of use cases, but I believe topics such as retention and meaningful connection will always be applicable to bots. Unfortunately the 1st Growth session is at the same time as Messenger, which means I might have to skip it.

All combined into my below schedule. I crossed out one session that is not relevant (about Canvas), and put a star next to the one I prioritize (when there is a conflict). You can also use it to watch the livestream broadcast.

Are you going to F8, too? Let’s connect! (@tammuses)
